tags.name: md-elevated-button
tags.description: Elevated buttons are essentially filled tonal buttons with a shadow. To prevent shadow creep, only use them when absolutely necessary, such as when the button requires visual separation from a patterned background.

tags.name: md-filled-button
tags.description: Filled buttons have the most visual impact after the FAB, and should be used for important, final actions that complete a flow, like Save, Join now, or Confirm.

tags.name: md-filled-tonal-button
tags.description: A filled tonal button is an alternative middle ground between filled and outlined buttons. They're useful in contexts where a lower-priority button requires slightly more emphasis than an outline would give, such as "Next" in an onboarding flow.

tags.name: md-outlined-button
tags.description: Outlined buttons are medium-emphasis buttons. They contain actions that are important, but aren't the primary action in an app.

tags.name: md-text-button
tags.description: Text buttons are used for the lowest priority actions, especially when presenting multiple options.

tags.name: md-checkbox
tags.description: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxes can turn an option on or off. There's one type of checkbox in Material. Use this selection control when the user needs to select one or more options from a list. Checkboxes may be standalone, pre-checked, or indeterminate.

tags.name: md-chip-set
tags.description: Chips help people enter information, make selections, filter content, or trigger actions.

tags.name: md-assist-chip
tags.description: Assist chips represent smart or automated actions that can span multiple apps, such as opening a calendar event from the home screen. Assist chips function as though the user asked an assistant to complete the action. They should appear dynamically and contextually in a UI.

tags.name: md-filter-chip
tags.description: Filter chips use tags or descriptive words to filter content. They can be a good alternative to toggle buttons or checkboxes.

tags.name: md-input-chip
tags.description: Input chips represent discrete pieces of information entered by a user, such as Gmail contacts or filter options within a search field. Input chips whose icons are user images may add the avatar attribute to display the image in a larger circle.

tags.name: md-suggestion-chip
tags.description: Suggestion chips help narrow a user's intent by presenting dynamically generated suggestions, such as possible responses or search filters.

tags.name: md-dialog
tags.description: Dialogs behave like <dialog> elements, and can be closed with a <form method="dialog"> element. Dialogs have three optional sections: the headline title, the main content, and action buttons.

tags.name: md-divider
tags.description: Dividers can reinforce tapability, such as when used to separate list items or define tappable regions in an accordion.

tags.name: md-elevation
tags.description: Material's elevation system is deliberately limited to just a handful of levels. This creative constraint means you need to make thoughtful decisions about your UI's elevation story.

tags.name: md-fab
tags.description: FAB represents the most important action on a screen. It puts key actions within reach.

tags.name: md-branded-fab
tags.description: Branded FABs use a brightly colored logo for their icon. Unlike FAB, branded FABs do not have color variants.

tags.name: md-focus-ring
tags.description: Focus rings are accessible outlines for components to show keyboard focus.

tags.name: md-icon-button
tags.description: Icon buttons can be grouped together or they can stand alone.

tags.name: md-filled-icon-button
tags.description: Filled icon buttons have higher visual impact and are best for high emphasis actions.

tags.name: md-filled-tonal-icon-button
tags.description: Filled tonal icon buttons are a middle ground between filled and outlined icon buttons. They're useful in contexts where the button requires slightly more emphasis than an outline would give, such as a secondary action paired with a high emphasis action.

tags.name: md-outlined-icon-button
tags.description: Outlined icon buttons are medium-emphasis buttons. They're useful when an icon button needs more emphasis than a standard icon button but less than a filled or filled tonal icon button.

tags.name: md-icon
tags.description: Icons can be used to represent common actions. Material Symbols are a set of variable icon fonts created at seven weights across three different styles.

tags.name: md-list
tags.description: Lists are continuous, vertical indexes of text and images

tags.name: md-list-item
tags.description: <md-list> is a container composed of <md-list-item>s of different types.

tags.name: md-menu
tags.description: Menus display a list of choices on a temporary surface.

tags.name: md-menu-item
tags.description: Menus also render menu items such as md-menu-item and handle keyboard navigation between md-menu-items as well as typeahead functionality. Additionally, md-menu interacts with md-menu-items to help you determine how a menu was closed. Listen for and inspect the close-menu custom event's details to determine what action and items closed the menu.

tags.name: md-sub-menu
tags.description: You can compose <md-menu>s inside of an <md-sub-menu>'s menu slot, but first the has-overflow attribute must be set on the root <md-menu> to disable overflow scrolling and display the nested submenus.

tags.name: md-circular-progress
tags.description: Circular progress indicators display progress by animating along an invisible circular track in a clockwise direction.

tags.name: md-linear-progress
tags.description: Linear progress indicators display progress by animating along the length of a fixed, visible track.

tags.name: md-radio
tags.description: Radios behave like <input type="radio"> elements and form a group with the same name attribute. Only one radio can be selected in a group.

tags.name: md-ripple
tags.description: Ripples display on hover and press pointer interactions. They may be attached to a control in one of three ways.

tags.name: md-filled-select
tags.description: Select menus display a list of choices on temporary surfaces and display the currently selected menu item above the menu.

tags.name: md-outlined-select
tags.description: Select menus display a list of choices on temporary surfaces and display the currently selected menu item above the menu.

tags.name: md-select-option
tags.description: Select (also referred to as a dropdown menu) allows choosing a value from a fixed list of available options. It is analogous to the native HTML <select> element.

tags.name: md-slider
tags.description: Sliders allow users to view and select a value (or range) along a track. They're ideal for adjusting settings such as volume and brightness, or for applying image filters.

tags.name: md-switch
tags.description: Switches toggle the state of an item on or off.

tags.name: md-tabs
tags.description: Tabs organize groups of related content that are at the same level of hierarchy.

tags.name: md-primary-tab
tags.description: Primary tabs are placed at the top of the content pane under a top app bar. They display the main content destinations.

tags.name: md-secondary-tab
tags.description: Secondary tabs are used within a content area to further separate related content and establish hierarchy.

tags.name: md-filled-text-field
tags.description: Filled and outlined text fields are functionally identical. See choosing a text field for guidance on which one to use.

tags.name: md-outlined-text-field
tags.description: Filled and outlined text fields are functionally identical. See choosing a text field for guidance on which one to use.
